articles.title: Reaching inside the jails to break the cycle of homeless arrests
articles.description: A door opened, and three men walked out of captivity into a sun-drenched waiting area. It’s a scene repeated hundreds of times a day at Los Angeles County Men’s Central Jail. But instead of being greeted by family members and friends, these men were met by Vi…

articles.author: Chelsea Hirsch
articles.title: How a kid from ‘Housewives’ landed in jail for attempted murder
articles.description: How did a boy from a gated community in Coto de Caza, Calif., — where the median listing price for a home is $1.4 million — end up behind bars, accused of a serious crime?

articles.title: Red tape traps teenagers seeking refuge in U.S.
articles.description: Like most teenagers in the United States, Luis looked forward to his 18th birthday. Unlike most teens, Luis’s excitement was not about being able to vote or buy cigarettes or other American rites of passage associated with turning 18, but about the prospect o…

articles.author: Olivia Schwob
articles.title: What Jail Can’t Do
articles.description: Frank Greene and Kenneth Ricci discuss the changing paradigms of half a century of justice architecture and what we should ask — and expect — from courts and jails. The post What Jail Can’t Do appeared first on Urban Omnibus.

articles.title: There are toxic secrets in Canada9s Chemical Valley
articles.description: There are 57 polluters registered with the Canadian and U.S. governments within 25 kilometres. Are the chemicals, spills and illnesses related?
